Articles.Content:
First off, I couldn't figure out where else this should go because it is just a discussion on a topic of Kerbal space program, I apologize now if its in the wrong area.

Ever wanted to make your own Kerbal voice? Well with some help from research and a friend we have figured it out! Its actually pretty simple just follow these steps.

1. Have a recording program capable of reversing a track and changing the pitch (I use audacity personally)

2. Record what you want to say.

3. Reverse the track.

4. Make the pitch higher, for my voice I had to increase it by roughly 43%

5. Listen and make adjustments to the pitch as needed.

Don't like using your voice because you can't get the pitch right? Well here is an alternative.

1. Still need a recording program.

2. Go to google translate.

3. Type something and translate it to Spanish.

4. Google translate has a button where you can listen to the translation, listen to it.

5. Record google talking to you.

6. Reverse the track.

7. Change the pitch 15% up. (this is the best value I found to sound "Kerbalish")

I found the need to have some Kerbal talking sounds when I started working on a video project and could not find any that were not distorted as if they were transmitted over a radio. I needed something like a Kerbal narration so after some brain storming and research came up with this!
This is that moment you realise speaking spanish is great.

This is that moment you realise speaking spanish is great.

All is right with the world!

{{The mods strike once more}} se labrek ne ralbah!!

Edited December 30, 2013 by sjwt
